--- title: "Data Cleaning" author: "Crystal Lewis, Shannon Pileggi, Peter Higgins, & Duncan Garmonsway" footer: "[Data Cleaning](https://shannonpileggi.github.io/rmedicine-data-cleaning-2023)" logo: "images/R-Med-logo-revised-pride.png" editor: source format: revealjs: theme: slides.scss transition: fade slide-number: true chalkboard: true execute: echo: true output: asis freeze: auto cache: true --- # Introduction ## Licensing
This work is licensed under [Creative Commons Zero v1.0 Universal](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/). ## Instructors ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} **Crystal Lewis** ![](images/Crystal_circle.png){width="40%"} **Shannon Pileggi** ![](images/Shannon_circle.png){width="40%"} ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} **Peter Higgins** ![](images/Peter_circle.jpg){width="40%"} **Duncan Garmonsway** ![](images/Shannon_circle.png){width="40%"} ::: ::: ## Checklist
``{=html} Install recent R release Current version 4.2.3 ``{=html} Install RStudio I am on version 2022.07.1+554 ``{=html} Install packages ``` r install.packages(c("gtreg", "gtsummary", "tidyverse", "labelled", "usethis")) ``` ``{=html} Ensure you can knit Rmarkdown files ## Schedule | Time | Activity | |:--------------|:-------------------| | 09:00 - 09:50 | Section 1 | | 09:50 - 10:00 | *Break* | | 10:00 - 10:50 | Section 2 | | 10:50 - 11:00 | *Break* | | 11:00 - 12:00 | Section 3 |
Please add any questions to the public Zoom chat. These may be answered in the moment or addressed at the end depending on context. # Crystal Section A ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 # Crystal Section B ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 # Shannon Section A ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 # Shannon Section B ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 # Wrangling your Data ## Deciding on the Unit of Observation Image ## Is it the Patient? - Patient over time - Outcome colectomy - labs over time ## Is it the Visit/Encounter? - Patient over time - Outcome colectomy - labs over time ## Reshaping your data with tidyr ## Pivoting Longer (common) - Visit Dates/Measures - Your Turn (Exercise) ## Pivoting Wider # Filling in Unobserved Dates/Times with padr ## Padding unobserved dates (weekends?) ## Padding unovserved times ## Joins of data from different sources ## Local Demographics with CDC SVI data (one to one) ## Patient Demographics with Lab results (one to many) # Duncan Section A ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 # Duncan Section B ## Slide 1 ## Slide 2 ## Thank you! üôè [Click here to submit workshop feedback](https://forms.gle/kvEirN7sJmavem8q6){target="_blank"}

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
